parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Overheating front brakes can cause warping of rotors, excessive drag, and damage to ABS sensors, leading to reduced braking performance and increased stopping distances, which can increase the risk of accidents.
symptoms: intermittent ABS light on the dashboard.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Overheating rear brakes can cause reduced braking performance and increased stopping distances, which can increase the risk of accidents.
symptoms: no brake drag found by mechanic.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Intermittent ABS Light and System Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: An intermittent ABS light can indicate a malfunctioning anti-lock brake system, which can lead to reduced braking performance and increased stopping distances, increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: Intermittent ABS light on the dashboard
indicating the anti-lock brake system is not functioning.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The intermittent failure of the instrument panel gauges can cause the driver to lose critical information about the vehicle's speed, fuel level, and other vital systems, which can lead to accidents or other safety issues.
symptoms: The gauges on the instrument panel fail to function intermittently
or other gauges may not work properly
the gauges may malfunction while the vehicle is in motion or at a stop
the failure may occur randomly with no apparent pattern.
